definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I'm sorry to be so short-tempered but I have an awful headache.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉脾气这么坏，所有是我头疼得要命。

sentences.english: But I have a headache at the thought of eating mutton.
sentences.chinese: 可我一想到涮羊肉就有点头疼。

sentences.english: No wonder we feel sick at the thought of choosing just one.
sentences.chinese: 要从中选一种三明治，难怪会让人觉得头疼。

sentences.english: The invention provides a traditional Chinese medicine composition for treating headache and slight fever.
sentences.chinese: 本发明提供一种治疗头疼脑热的中药组合物。

sentences.english: Exhaust fumes made him drowsy and brought on a headache.
sentences.chinese: 废气把他熏得昏昏沉沉，还引起了头疼。

sentences.english: Of course, perhaps even more troubling is the satanic parallel as well.
sentences.chinese: 当然，或许更令人头疼的是在撒旦身上进行的类比。

sentences.english: It can damage the teeth, give you headaches and make your jaw hurt.
sentences.chinese: 这会损伤牙齿，让人头疼并使颌骨受损。

sentences.english: And, I don't know, it can be nerve-wracking sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 而且，我不知道，这有时候可能让人头疼。

sentences.english: Migraines have been linked to seizures in recent studies.
sentences.chinese: 在最近的研究中偏头疼可能引起突发性疾病。

sentences.english: White fat is the energy- caching padding that vexes doctors and dieters.
sentences.chinese: 白色脂肪是令医生和节食者头疼的储藏能量的物质。

sentences.english: Plastic surgery could bring relief to millions people who suffer from migraines.
sentences.chinese: 整形手术或许能给几百万偏头疼患者带来福音。

sentences.english: Custody of their infant daughter became a major issue, both say.
sentences.chinese: 他们都为他们第一个宝宝的抚养权问题头疼。
这种药使她的头疼得到缓解。

sentences.english: The visual disturbances and blinding headaches were the worst.
sentences.chinese: 视觉障碍和炫目头疼是最糟糕的。

sentences.english: Common cold symptoms are runny nose, sore throat and headache.
sentences.chinese: 一般的感冒症状也就是流流鼻涕，喉咙疼和头疼。
哈里波特会导致“霍格华兹头疼”？

definition: to be vexed or annoyed/to feel queasy
to blow one's top/to be driven mad/to become frantic
to feel agitated/to be troubled/to be annoyed/an upset or distraction
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
